intro: Stemodia serrata, commonly known as the serrated stemodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with rough, serrated leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, woody fruits. Stemodia serrata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or saline soils.
